page.title: 19HAMSTERLEY MILL ESTATE
page.content: My name is Jonathan and I live at Hamsterley Mill which is a hamlet built on land previously owned by Lord Gort. It is about two miles from Rowlands Gill in the Derwent Valley. The land was sold in large plots to people who had houses built individually. No two houses had to be the same. The roads in the estate are all private and are very rural looking, having broad verges and a lot of trees. It is a very quiet, peaceful place to live. At the top of our garden is the Derwent Walk which was the old railway line from Swalwell to Consett. This has been turned into a lovely walk with picnic places. Some of the old railway buildings can still be seen - there is a station platform at Lintzford. Nearer to us are two large viaducts which are very impressive.
